thread.title: Pistons might pick up swingman Reggie Bullock's 2016-17 option
thread.title_full: Pistons might pick up swingman Reggie Bullock's 2016-17 option

author: freep.com
title: Pistons might pick up swingman Reggie Bullock's 2016-17 option
text:
MORE Barring something unforeseen, Reggie Bullock will be on the Detroit Pistons' opening-night roster.
Bullock has scored a knockout against the competition in the fight for a roster spot.
He has played so well that he could be part of the team's plans past this season.
The Pistons face a Nov. 2 deadline to pick up Bullock's $2.2-million option for the 2016-17 season, and a person with firsthand knowledge of the team's thought process told the Free Press this past week the move is under serious consideration.
Bullock, 24, was a throw-in the Phoenix Suns salary dump that brought the Pistons forward Marcus Morris.
DETROIT FREE PRESS
DBB: Pistons reaching point of tough roster decisions
In two previous seasons with the Suns and Los Angeles Clippers, the 2013 first-round pick from North Carolina has failed to excel.
But he has quickly earned coach Stan Van Gundy's confidence and played well in three exhibition appearances. He is 8-for-16 from three-point range and averaging 12.3 points per game.
And the most important factor is his willing defense at the wing spots.
"If they pick this up, I know that I will be here at least still getting paid NBA money," Bullock said Saturday with a laugh. "I'm just trying to find a place, and Detroit would be the perfect place for me to be able to start my young career and actually be here and actually learn things as part of this system and organization.
"I've done my traveling already. I've been to L.A., I've been to Phoenix, and I'm just trying to find a home and just go out and play hard as I can."
â–  Still thinking: Van Gundy said he still is choosing among Morris, Stanley Johnson and Ersan Ilyasova at the forward spots in today's exhibition at San Antonio.
Contact Vince Ellis at vellis@freepress.com . Follow him on Twitter @vincent_ellis56 .
Tonight: Spurs
Matchup: Detroit (2-3 in exhibition season) at San Antonio (0-3).
Tip-off: 4 p.m.
Where: AT&T Center, San Antonio.
TV/radio: No TV, WMGC-FM (105.1).
